alert.note: Alert for Armstrong; Carson; Dallam; Deaf Smith; Hansford; Hartley; Hutchinson; Moore; Oldham; Palo Duro Canyon; Potter; Randall; Sherman (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued April 01 at 10:03PM CDT until April 05 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 10 PM CDT SUNDAY FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR WESTERN AND CENTRAL SECTIONS OF THE OKLAHOMA AND TEXAS PANHANDLES... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING THROUGH MONDAY EVENING FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR WESTERN AND CENTRAL SECTIONS OF THE OKLAHOMA AND TEXAS PANHANDLES... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR WESTERN AND CENTRAL SECTIONS OF THE OKLAHOMA AND TEXAS PANHANDLES... * Affected Area...In Oklahoma...Cimarron. In Texas...Dallam... Sherman...Hansford...Hartley...Moore...Hutchinson...Oldham... Potter...Carson...Deaf Smith...Randall...Armstrong and Palo Duro Canyon. * 20 Foot Winds...Sunday, southwest at 15 to 20 mph. Monday, southwest at 20 to 30 mph, and Tuesday, westerly at 30 to 40 mph with gusts up to 65 mph. * Relative Humidity...As low as 7 percent Sunday and Monday and 10 percent Tuesday. * Red Flag Threat Index...4 on Sunday and 7 on Monday and Tuesday. * Timing...Sunday noon to 10 PM. Monday 10 AM to midnight. Tuesday 6 AM to midnight.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now...or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures will create favorable weather for rapid fire growth and spread. Avoid activities that promote open flames and sparks. A Fire Weather Watch means that the potential for critical fire weather conditions exists. Listen for later forecasts and possible red flag warnings.
